sen.j: 正子内親王は、日本の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Masako was the Japanese imperial family.
Imperial Princess Masako was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family.
Imperial Princess Masako was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family.

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇の皇女の正子内親王（まさこないしんのう、大同4年（810年） - 元慶3年3月23日（879年4月18日））。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Masako (810 - April 18, 879) was the princess of Emperor Saga.
Imperial Princess Masako (810 - April 18, 879) was the princess of Emperor Saga.
Imperial Princess Masako (810 - April 18, 879) was the princess of Emperor Saga.

sen.j: 母は皇后橘嘉智子。
sen.e: Her mother was Empress TACHIBANA no Kachiko.
Her mother was Empress TACHIBANA no Kachiko.
Her mother was Empress TACHIBANA no Kachiko.

sen.j: 本項で詳述する。
sen.e: Detail will be in this paragraph.
Details will be provided in this paragraph.
sen.cmt: I can't see any reason why this sentence would suddenly appear here. It seems to be some kind of metadata. If it is metadata, then the translation should probably be something like "Details should be provided in this paragraph.".
sen.e: Details will be provided in this section.
sen.cmt: ＮＣのコメント同様、原文の前後関係がよくわかりません。"Paragraph"→"section"に変更しました。

sen.j: 後朱雀天皇の皇女の正子内親王（まさこないしんのう、寛徳2年（1045年） - 永久2年8月20日（1114年9月27日））。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Masako (1045 - September 27, 1114) was the princess of Emperor Gosuzaku.
Imperial Princess Masako (1045 - September 27, 1114) was the princess of Emperor Gosuzaku.
Imperial Princess Masako (1045 - September 27, 1114) was the princess of Emperor Gosuzaku.

sen.j: 母は藤原頼宗女、女御藤原延子。
sen.e: Her mother was a nyogo (a court title given to a consort of the Emperor), FUJIWARA no Enshi(Nobuko), who was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Yorimune.
Her mother was a nyogo (a court title given to a consort of the Emperor), FUJIWARA no Enshi (Nobuko), who was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Yorimune.
Her mother was a nyogo (a court title given to a consort of the Emperor), FUJIWARA no Enshi (Nobuko), who was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Yorimune.

sen.j: 後冷泉天皇・後三条天皇朝斎院。
sen.e: Emperor Goreizei and Emperor Gosanjo dynasty Saiin (an unmarried princess who, in former times, was sent by the emperor to serve at Kamo Shrine).
sen.cmt: 正子内親王との関係がよく分かりませんでした。
sen.e: Emperor Goreizei and Emperor Gosanjo dynasty Saiin (an unmarried princess who, in former times, was sent by the emperor to serve at Kamo Shrine).
Emperor Goreizei and Emperor Gosanjo dynasty Saiin (an unmarried princess who, in former times, was sent by the emperor to serve at Kamo Shrine).

sen.j: 正子内親王（まさこないしんのう、大同4年（810年） - 元慶3年3月23日（879年4月18日））は、第52代嵯峨天皇の皇女。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Masako (810 - April 18, 879) was the princess of the fifty-second Emperor Saga.
Imperial Princess Masako (810 - April 18, 879) was the princess of the fifty-second Emperor Saga.
Imperial Princess Masako (810 - April 18, 879) was the princess of the fifty-second Emperor Saga.

sen.j: 母は皇后橘嘉智子。
sen.e: Her mother was Empress TACHIBANA no Kachiko.
Her mother was Empress TACHIBANA no Kachiko.
Her mother was Empress TACHIBANA no Kachiko.

sen.j: 淳和天皇皇后。
sen.e: She was the Empress of Emperor Junna.
She was the Empress of Emperor Junna.
She was the Empress of Emperor Junna.

sen.j: 同母兄弟に仁明天皇（同年の生まれのため、双子の兄弟であったと考えられる）。
sen.e: Her half brother was Emperor Ninmyo (they were born in the same year, so they appeared to be twin brothers).
Her half brother was Emperor Ninmyo (they were born in the same year, so they appeared to be twins).
Her half brother was Emperor Ninmyo (they were born in the same year, so they appeared to be twins).

sen.j: 弘仁14年（823年）頃、叔父淳和天皇に入内。
sen.e: In around 823, she made her bridal entry into the court of her uncle, Emperor Junna.
In around 823, she made her bridal entry into the court of her uncle, Emperor Junna.
In around 823, she made her bridal entry into the court of her uncle, Emperor Junna.

sen.j: 天長4年（827年）皇后に冊立。
sen.e: She was officially appointed as the empress.
She was officially appointed as the empress.
She was officially appointed as the empress in 827.

sen.j: 同10年（833年）に淳和天皇が退位、皇太后となる。
sen.e: Emperor Junna abdicated in 833, and became the empress dowager.
Emperor Junna abdicated in 833, and she became the empress dowager.
Emperor Junna abdicated in 833, and she became the empress dowager.

sen.j: 同時に長男恒貞親王が仁明天皇皇太子に立坊。
sen.e: Her eldest son, Imperial Prince Tsunesada, was officially appointed as Crown Prince of Emperor Ninmyo.
Her eldest son, Imperial Prince Tsunesada, was officially appointed as the Crown Prince of Emperor Ninmyo.
Her eldest son, Imperial Prince Tsunesada, was officially appointed as the Crown Prince of Emperor Ninmyo.

sen.j: 承和7年（840年）、淳和上皇の崩御に伴い落飾。
sen.e: In 840, she shaved her head to entered the priesthood with Emperor Junna's death,
sen.cmt: 落飾→shaving head to enter the priesthood【定訳不明】
sen.e: In 840, she shaved her head to entered the priesthood upon Emperor Junna's death,
In 840, she shaved her head to entered the priesthood upon Retired Emperor Junna's death,

sen.j: 同9年（842年）、恒貞親王が承和の変で廃太子、正子内親王も出家。
sen.e: In 842, Imperial Prince Tsunesada was abdicated from the Prince due to the Jyowa Incident and Imperial Princess Masako became a priest.
In 842, Imperial Prince Tsunesada abdicated as Prince due to the Jyowa Incident and Imperial Princess Masako became a priest.
In 842, Imperial Prince Tsunesada abdicated as Prince due to the Jowa Incident and Imperial Princess Masako became a priest.

sen.j: 仁寿4年（854年）太皇太后。
sen.e: In 854, she became the Grand Empress Dowager.
In 854, she became the Grand Empress Dowager.
In 854, she became the Grand Empress Dowager.

sen.j: 貞観2年（860年）天台座主円仁より受戒、法名は良祚（りょうそ）。
sen.e: In 860, she received the orders of Buddhism by the head priest of the Tendai sect, Ennin, and her Buddhist name was Ryoso.
In 860, she received the orders of Buddhism by the head priest of the Tendai sect, Ennin, and her Buddhist name was Ryoso.
In 860, she received the orders of Buddhism by the head priest of the Tendai sect, Ennin, and her Buddhist name was Ryoso.

sen.j: 元慶3年（879年）崩御、
sen.e: She died in 879. She was seventy years old.
She died in 879. She was seventy years old.
She died in 879.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 享年70。
sen.e: She was seventy years old.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 容貌美しくしとやかな優しい女性で、母の徳もよく備えていたという。
sen.e: She was beautiful, modest, and gentle woman, and had a virtue as a mother.
She was a beautiful, modest, and gentle woman, and had the virtue of a mother.
She was a beautiful, modest, and gentle woman, and had the virtue of a mother.

sen.j: 恒貞親王始め3人の皇子を産んだが、恒貞親王は後に承和の変で皇太子を廃され、この陰謀の影にいた母・嘉智子太皇太后を、正子内親王は激しく怒り泣いて恨んだと『日本三代実録』に伝えられる。
sen.e: She had three sons including Imperial Prince Tsunesada, but Imperial Prince Tsunesada was abdicated from the Prince later due to the Jyowa Incident, and "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" described that she got really mad, cried, and hold a grudge against her mother, Kachiko, the Grand Empress Dowager, who was behind the plot.

She had three sons including Imperial Prince Tsunesada, but Imperial Prince Tsunesada abdicated later due to the Jyowa Incident, and "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" described that she got really mad, cried, and held a grudge against her mother, Kachiko, the Grand Empress Dowager, who was behind the plot.

She had three sons including Imperial Prince Tsunesada, but Imperial Prince Tsunesada abdicated later due to the Jowa Incident, and "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (sixth of the six classical Japanese history texts) described that she got really mad, cried, and held a grudge against her mother, Kachiko, the Grand Empress Dowager, who was behind the plot.
sen.cmt: Jyowa→Jowa(sixth of the six classical Japanese history texts)補足スペース削除

sen.j: その後は父・嵯峨上皇の旧宮嵯峨院を大覚寺に改めて済治院（僧尼のための医療施設）を置き、また淳和院を道場にするなど、仏教に篤く帰依して救民に力を尽くした。
sen.e: Later, she sited Saichiin (medical facility for monks and nuns) in Daikaku-ji Temple by rebuilding the old palace of Emperor Saga, her father, and made Junnain into a dojo, and devoted her energy to save people by taking refuge in the Buddhism.

Later, she set up Saichiin (medical facility for monks and nuns) in Daikaku-ji Temple by rebuilding the old palace of Emperor Saga, her father, and made Junnain into a dojo, and devoted her energy to save people who took refuge in Buddhism.

Later, she set up Saichiin (medical facility for monks and nuns) in Daikaku-ji Temple by rebuilding the old palace of Retired Emperor Saga, her father, and made Junnain into a dojo, and devoted her energy to save people who took refuge in Buddhism.

sen.j: 陵墓は円山陵墓参考地（京都府京都市右京区嵯峨大覚寺門前登り町）。
sen.e: Her Ryobo is in Maruyama Ryobo (Imperial mausoleums) Sankochi (Saga Daikakuji Monzen Nobori-cho Town, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).
Her Ryobo is in Maruyama Ryobo (Imperial mausoleums) Sankochi (Saga Daikakuji Monzen Nobori-cho Town, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).
The imperial mausoleum is in Maruyama Ryobo Sankochi (Saga Daikakuji Monzen Nobori-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).
